intro: Tapeinosperma squarrosum, commonly known as the rough-seeded sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with a rough texture, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils.
